headline: CPI print is 'a yawn,' signaling data is holding up despite tariffs
text: April's consumer price index (CPI) showed inflation cooled, marking the lowest annual increase since February 2021. Prairie Operating Co. executive vice president of market strategy, Lou Basenese, joins Catalysts Host Madison Mills to take a closer look at the economic data and what it means for the US economy, Wall Street, and the Federal Reserve, as well as sharing some of his top stock picks in the tech sector. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: Amazon, Meta lead 'Magnificent 7' stock surge on temporary US-China trade truce
text: Amazon and Meta stocks led the "Magnificent Seven" Big Tech stock surge after the US and China announced a temporary trade war truce.

headline: Veteran Investor Trims Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) Stake, Predicts GOOGL’s Ad Revenue Will Fall
text: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) ad revenue will drop going forward, veteran investor Kevin Simpson predicted on Friday on CNBC. Simpson, the founder and Chief Investment Officer of Capital Wealth, sold a portion of his Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) holdings recently. Also making bearish comments on Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) during the same segment was Brenda Vingiello, the Chief […]

headline: Break Up Alphabet? It May Be the ‘Only Way Forward’ for Google Stock.
text: D.A. Davidson analyst Gil Luria sees Alphabet stock doomed to trade at an unimpressive 16 times earnings, unless the company takes bold action by breaking itself into pieces.

headline: Google Facing at Least €12 Billion in Civil Claims Across Europe
text: (Bloomberg) -- Alphabet Inc.’s Google is facing at least €12 billion ($13.3 billion) in damage claims from dozens of price comparison websites across the European Union which allege that the search and advertising giant stole their customers, according to a Bloomberg News review.Most Read from BloombergA New Central Park Amenity, Tailored to Its East Harlem NeighborsWhat’s Behind the Rise in Serious Injuries on New York City’s Streets?NYC Warns of 17% Drop in Foreign Tourists Due to Trump Polici

headline: Perplexity AI in late-stage talks to raise $500m at $14bn valuation
text: The AI search engine company competes with Google and Microsoft-backed OpenAI.

headline: Advanced Micro Devices Stock (AMD) Stuck in Neutral as AI Boom Accelerates
text: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has been a disappointing stock over the past year, with declines accelerating in the last five months. Since May 2024, AMD has been down almost 32%. Amid growing concerns about demand for AI infrastructure chips, AMD has also struggled with a lack of competitiveness in absorbing that demand. Even after posting a beat across the board in its Q1 earnings last week and supplementing that with raised Q2 guidance, there are still no strong signs of a reversal in the beari

headline: Tesla Stock vs. Apple Stock: The Best buy Right Now, According to Wall Street
text: Most Wall Street analysts see downside in Tesla stock and upside in Apple stock in the next 12 months, but investors should do their own research. Tesla shares trade at an expensive valuation, but the company's earnings growth may accelerate as the company leans into robotaxis and robots. Apple stock is expensive, and the company is battling headwinds related to tariffs, antitrust legislation, and its failure to monetize AI in a meaningful way.

headline: Is Alphabet Stock a Buy Now?
text: The market share for Google Search has fallen below 90% for the first time in years. Alphabet's diversification away from advertising revenue has moved slowly. The company's valuation and free cash flows could still make the stock attractive.

headline: Google Parent Alphabet Is Now the Cheapest "Magnificent Seven" Stock. You Might Be Surprised Which Stock Ranks Second.
text: Alphabet is the cheapest "Magnificent Seven" stock based on the trailing-12-month P/E, forward P/E, and PEG ratios. Nvidia is the second-cheapest member of the group based on its PEG ratio. Whether these stocks are good picks depends on the reliability of analysts' growth estimates.

headline: Nvidia Has Plenty of Runway, This Hedge Fund Legend Says. Why He’s Less Enthused About Apple and Google.
text: In picking stocks, hedge fund investor Dan Benton has prioritized product cycles and earnings surprises over valuation. Why he likes Nvidia right now.

headline: Traders Slash RBA Easing Bets as US-China De-Escalate on Tariffs
text: (Bloomberg) -- Traders are winding back bets on aggressive monetary easing by Australia in a cascading effect from the US and China agreeing to temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products.Most Read from BloombergA New Central Park Amenity, Tailored to Its East Harlem NeighborsAs Trump Reshapes Housing Policy, Renters Face Rollback of RightsWhat’s Behind the Rise in Serious Injuries on New York City’s Streets?NYC Warns of 17% Drop in Foreign Tourists Due to Trump PoliciesLA Mayor Credits T

headline: AI effect prompts Google parent stock-rating tweak
text: Wedbush analysts wonder about the volatility of the search engine giant's stock.

headline: Google is developing software AI agent ahead of annual conference, The Information reports
text: The agent is intended to help software engineers navigate every stage of the software process, from responding to tasks to documenting code, the report said, citing three people who have seen demonstrations of the product or been told about it by Google employees. Google declined to comment when contacted by Reuters. Investors have been piling pressure on Google to show returns on the billions poured into artificial intelligence as competition intensifies in the industry.

headline: Tesla to Debut Self-Driving Taxi in June as Robotaxi Wars Begin
text: While Tesla is behind in the robotaxi race, its lower cost could allow it to catch up in scale and also enjoy jucier profit margins in the long run.
